title: Show us your site
content:
Okay, so we've seen [your desk](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/14264.html) and we've seen your [sketches](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/21120.html). Now show us your web site.   
   
\_\_\_\_\_   
Ours was two years overdue. (But not two years in the making.)   
   
 [http://www.punchcut.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.punchcut.com/)
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: [15](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.15works.com/)
[Work](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.ms-studio.com/) and [goofing off](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.marksverylarge.com/).

[Pays the bills.](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.veer.com/)   
 [Personal thrills.](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.splorp.com/)   
 [Time kills.](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.compunabula.com/)

Hey Stuart, nice job on Mister Retro, babe. But I think you're undervaluing your [Snappy Hour](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.misterretro.com/vector_images.html) collection. Given what [Chuck & Co.](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.csaimages.com/) ask for similar imagery, you should be bumping and grinding your price up at least a notch or two.

[madtype.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.madtype.net/)   
 [mattdesmond.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.mattdesmond.com/)   
 [testpilotcollective](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.testpilotcollective.com/)

[http://www.synergyprod.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.synergyprod.com/) (still in the works -- and yes, I know this is a lame disclaimer)   
   
Work & Life

Ok.   
It works better in the summer, though.   
 [http://www.kennmunk.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.kennmunk.com/)

[work](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.studiolift.com/) and in need of an update...   
   
and my personal site still isn't off the ground after starting it 5 months ago ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)

[Passion](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.underconsideration.com/)   
 [Work](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.underconsideration.com/portfolio)   
 [Hobby](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.parallelmotions.com/)

The [company](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.commarts.net/) I work for, and my [personal site](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.addisonhall.com/).   
   
This is a great post -- I love seeing everyone's personal stuff.
No site for me yet. But my wife, the scenic designer, has [one](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.home.earthlink.net/~akraut/) (her first).
I'm [andyclymer.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.andyclymer.com/) and I work for [viadesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.viadesign.com/).

my personal site - [http://www.hellofonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.hellofonts.com/)   
   
my design firm site - [http://www.sumodesign.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.sumodesign.co.uk/)   
   
my font label site - [http://www.unionfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.unionfonts.com/)

Great work guys! This is fun.   
   
Mine at [work](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.motiontheory.com/) (yes, I know about the choice of type for the logo, but it's inherited...)   
   
Beautiful logo, Kyle, btw. Funny, I've been enjoying the fStop site for a while but who knew it was by our own Jared&Joe...
[stuff](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.famished.org/).
Punchcut and Mr. Retro are looking great!

Good morning from Finland,   
   
I have enjoyed my journey through these sites. I detect several uses of printers fleurons and ornaments "creeping in".   
   
Behind these "old fashioned" wrinkles is a fresh, clean shaven face.   
   
 [http://www.lanstontype.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.lanstontype.com/)
Greetings from Germany [astype.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.astype.de/)
here's mine: [http://torped.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/torped.net/)

Andreas Johanson, you forgot to say 'Hello from Sweden!'   
Everything was getting really 'Eurovision Song Contest'. ;-)

This is mine: [http://nobodoni.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/nobodoni.com/)   
   
And my brother's: [http://www.finetuned.com/flash\_index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.finetuned.com/flash_index.html)
[work](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.monolinea.com/) and [play](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.pixilate.com/)

what the heck, it's nuffin to be too proud of, but here are my work sites:   
 [www.remindernews.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.remindernews.com/) and [www.winslowaznews.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.winslowaznews.com/)   
We did a little rebranding on both of our products this past week and hopefully these sites will be sporting our new logos here shortly. If ya take time to browse around you'll see some of my work.

hey folks! I haven't been around in while, but I'm still trying to   
keep up with the prolific contributions via e-mail.   
   
the primary reason for my absense has been the studio [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.plain-clothes.com/) site   
serves. I know it's simple (I'm no web tech), but it's working for   
us so far. I'm planning to do more with the space as time   
becomes available.   
   
feel free to post here or e-mail me from the site with any   
comments (read: harsh critiques).   
   
you've all got some really great projects posted, btw!   
   
http://www.plain-clothes.com/

Kyle, Fedra kicks fanny.   
Armin, parallelmotions is sad it's so beautiful.   
   
--   
   
I used to be happy with my site ( [http://www.themicrofoundry.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.themicrofoundry.com/)) before I realized the specimens are too small and they should be in Flash, and before MacOS went full-fuzz making my Georgia-Bold look horrid, but I still think you guys need to be making more horizontal sites. :-)   
   
When I redo my site I think I'm going for the full effect of the name and looking like I actually brew beer in my backyard instead.   
   
hhp

Wow, there are some heavy hitters on this forum! (I'm a newbie -- can you tell?) Grant Hutchinson (say hi to J.Parker for me), former lightboxer Armin Vit, and probably a few others I'm failing to recognize.   
   
Anyway, [here's mine](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.cameronmoll.com/). v2 in the works.   
   
btw, love the machine wash filters, Mister Retro.

Mine is nothing big...   
   
 [Portfolio](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.antiuser.org/)   
 [Personal weirdness 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.antiuser.org/anti.likesilver)   
 [Personal weirdness 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/deathofaphilosopher.antiuser.org/)

\> _...Grant Hutchinson (say hi to J. Parker for me)..._   
   
Will do.   
   
I forgot how much juicy goodness you pack into your site, Cameron. I'm going to have to make it a regular visit. By the way, you may be interested in knowing that I posted a new bout of [Lightboxing](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.veer.com/ideas/lightboxing/) yesterday.
Sweet... added to my homepage under "Linkage"

Most of them :-)

How a guy from a old Europe country can rival to any guy from any country from the modern world? :-)

An experiment with some new software and some seething:   
   
 [Rage & Incomprehension](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/homepage.mac.com/jon_whipple/rage).   
   
Can you see the graphics in the left column in IE6Win? Just noticed it might be a problem today.   
   
 [Finn](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/homepage.mac.com/jon_whipple/)

\> Can you see the graphics in the left column in IE6Win?   
   
Nope. Just the text (nicely set) on the right 3/4.   
   
hhp

Thanks Hrant, I fixed it. IE6Win doesn't do position:fixed apparently. The power of CSS: the text looks pretty nice on my Mac too, I'm glad it looks good on Windows.   
   
Jon
Joe, you were primarily responsible for the design direction of jetBlue? I had no idea. Every time I fly with them I'm impressed by how well everything is put together. Awesome work.

[www.phivedesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.phivedesign.com/)   
   
bunch of silliness really. I lost my fancy swf files to a bad download and made pluther of what-ever as a temp - and why bother cleaning it up really? I've learned that nobody really surfs it anyway. haha

Go easy...   
   
 [http://stereotypography.com/other/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/stereotypography.com/other/)
Great stuff, Luke -- the navigation could be a bit more user-friendly, but I think the work is worth the hurdle.
Cheers Dave.
[www.leftofsix.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.leftofsix.com/)
Haha thanks Tiffany!
Love the experimental Ive interface, Colin. Juicy enough to be added to "Linkage" on my site.
There's always [Alterpop](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.alterpop.com/).
Tres fun. Keep 'em coming.

JFP, are you're trying to rival Grant in proliferation of URLs?   
   
=)
:: Blushing :: Thanks Dave. I kick myself everytime I think about the stock I didn't buy.

Colin. Nice work. Great music.   
   
That's not to say your work isn't great, I just really enjoyed the music.
Recently completed and launched two days ago: [http://www.misterretro.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222185401/http:/www.misterretro.com/)
